original_title: Multiple migrants charged with child assault near Boston amid Wu's outrage | Fox News
article_summary: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu responds to Attorney General Pam Bondi's warning over sanctuary city policies, following a series of child abuse cases involving migrants in Boston and its suburbs. Notable incidents include the arrest of Cory Bernard Alvarez, a Haitian national accused of raping a child at a migrant shelter, and Jose Fernando-Perez, a Guatemalan immigrant charged with forcible rape of a child. ICE continues to prioritize the arrest and removal of egregious noncitizen offenders from the New England community.</s>
